title: Solar Activity
subtitle: How the 11-year cycle reshapes solar wind composition
description: Solar wind composition breathes in sync with the Sun's 11-year activity cycle. Fast wind from coronal holes maintains stable abundances regardless of solar activity, while slow wind abundances rise during solar maximum and crash during solar minimum—with heavier elements showing stronger modulation due to gravitational settling.

related_figures.relevance: Extends the helium finding across the periodic table, confirming the fast/slow dichotomy is universal
Reveals the physical mechanism: gravitational settling preferentially depletes heavier elements during solar minimum
Reveals that helium doesn't respond instantaneously—delay increases linearly with speed, providing a window into source region response times
Demonstrates predictive capability: helium shutoff consistently precedes solar minimum by ~10 months across four cycles

related_topics.connection: Helium abundance varies dramatically with the solar cycle
Heavy ion abundances show similar solar cycle modulation

paper.title: Heavy ion abundances evolve with solar activity
